intro: Sphaeralcea creeana, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Sphaeralcea creeana is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to arid environments.
